intro: Castilleja latifolia var. wightii, commonly known as the broadleaf paintbrush, is a hemiparasitic flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family and is characterized by its showy, red-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has reduced leaves and relies on root connections to host plants for water and nutrients. It typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its ecological role includes providing nectar for pollinators and serving as a food source for certain herbivores.
